overview_of_class: This course is designed as a survey of the relationships between ethnicity, socialization, and personality and behavior issues related to current race relations. Upon completion of the course students will be able to: 1) Identify and describe the major components and principles of multicultural competence, awareness, knowledge, skills, and values; 2) discuss alternative conceptions of cultural, ethnic, and cultural psychology and the role played by different academic disciplines in describing and researching an individual's behavior, worldview, attitudes, and values; 3) recognize and describe how cross-cultural psychology theories explain the influence of the human condition at universal and cultural-specific levels; 4) Analyze and critique scientific research articles that describe and present research findings on cross-cultural topics; 5) demonstrate an understanding of how well Western psychological principles and research hold up in other cultures; and 6) demonstrate increased cultural awareness and sensitivity, which includes subjective and objective perceptions of ethnic groups and the role culture plays in human and social behavior.
name: Cultural Psychology
subject: PSYCH
